CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper January 25, 1947, pg. 17, reads: "'All-White' Community - Another view of the 'all-white' veteran's emergency housing project in Clairton shows in the background houses in Colonial Village. Colonial Village is a privately owned settlement of one-family homes near Woodland Terrace, Clairton's all-white low-rent Government housing project. Situated high on a hill overlooking the city of Clairton proper, the Malmade Village project boasts of having no more than three or four frame buildings in contrast to an 'all-frame houses' Negro vets settlement. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: One story houses with Insulbrick siding, future homes of white only veterans in Malmade Village, with Colonial Village in background, Clairton, Pennsylvania
